result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody S Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
This sentence is to be concurrent to the sentences in 15CF07.
This sentence is to commence forthwith

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay subpoena fees in the amount of $82
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling  as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/ or education program per agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, liquor stores or taverns
--complete a Certified Batterer Intervention Program
--No Contact with Heather Heise
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Request denied as the Court declines to interfere with DOC's collection powers which are established by law.
Defendant's Motion for an Order Establishing Payment Plan After Reelase

ADDRESS INFO for Cody Campbell
Current: PO Box 233, C/O Jackson Correctional Institution, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 11-17-2016)
Prior: PO Box 700, One West Lincoln St., c/o Dodge Correctional Inst., Waupun, WI 53963 United States
of the 6/16/15 Plea and Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable Judge Randy R. Koschnick
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 15CF07 and 15CM104 called together at 3:29pm [mo]
[Both cases scheduled for FSSC]
Defendant Cody S Campbell in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Case 15CF07 Counts #1, #5, #6 & #8 and Case 15CM104 Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Campbell  guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On the Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: all remaining counts

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
On Case 15CF07 Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Campbell   to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  years .Concurrent with any previously imposed sentence. This sentence is to commence forthwith 


On Case 15CF07 Counts #5, #6, & #8:The Court sentences Mr. Campbell   to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  1 year. This is to be served concurrent with the sentence in Count #1 This sentence is to commence forthwith

On Case 15CM104 Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Campbell   to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year. This sentence is to be concurrent to the sentences in 15CF07 This sentence is to commence forthwith 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling  as required by the Agent
--
to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/ or education program per agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, liquor stores or taverns
--complete a Certified Batterer Intervention Program
--No Contact with Heather Heise
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--On Case 15CF07 pay subpoena fees in the amount of $119
--On Case 15CM104 pay subpoena fees in the amount of $82
--On Case 15CF07 Count #1: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
 plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--On Case 15CF07 Count #5:
 to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--On Case 15CF07 Count #6:
 to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--On Case 15CF07 Count #8:to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--On Case 15CM104 Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

On Case 15CF07: The Court gives  0  days credit for time already served.
On Case 15CM104: The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.
recess:3:55pm
the Defendant from DCI for the 6/16/15 FSSC & the 6/22-23/15 JT
Proposed Order to Produce for the FSSC & JT
Jury trial on June 22/23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Request for Detainer with fax confirmation

Case called at 8:35am [mo]
Defendant Cody S Campbell appears via video conferencing from DCI, in custody. His Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek appears in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
   
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial demanded by the defense 

The Court requires $5000  CASH bond, with conditions: 
--the defendant is to not have contact with Heather Huise
--the defendant is not to have contact with Heather Huise if released from custody or if he remains in custody pursuant to statute 940.47

The Court orders the State to prepare a Writ for Mr. Campbell to appear in person on the FSSC and Jury Trial dates.
recess: 8:40am 


NEXT:  (1)FSSC: June 16, 2015 at 3:00pm (2) Jury Trial June 22 and 23, 2015 at 8:30am(Mr. Campbell is to appear in person at these hearings, State to prepare Writ)
Initial appearance on May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV:  
case called at 9:07am 
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court.  ADA Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for Initial Appearance today and arrangements had been made for Defendant Cody Campbell to appear via videoconferencing from the Dane County Jail.  However Dane County Jail staff contacted court staff this morning to say that Mr. Campbell has now been transferred to DCI. 
Attorney Svehlek requests that the Initial Appearance be rescheduled as soon as possible because Mr. Campbell's other pending Jefferson County case is scheduled for FSSC and Jury Trial later this month.
recess 9:09am.


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on Thursday May 7th at 10:30am (arrangements are to be made for Mr. Campbell to appear by v/c from DCI)
